stories.author: BBC News
stories.title: Attacks on Afghan mosques kill scores
stories.description: Some 60 people are killed as worshippers are targeted in two separate attacks on mosques.

stories.author: AMIR SHAH
stories.title: Suicide bombings in Afghanistan hit mosques, killing 63
stories.description: KABUL, Afghanistan (AP) — Suicide bombers struck two mosques in Afghanistan during Friday prayers, a Shiite mosque in Kabul and a Sunni mosque in western Ghor province, killing at least 63 people at the end of a particularly deadly week for the troubled nation. The Afghan president issued a statement condemning both attacks and saying that country's security forces would step up the fight to "eliminate the terrorists who target Afghans of all religions and tribes."

stories.author: Al Jazeera
stories.title: Deadly attacks hit mosques in Kabul and Ghor
stories.description: Shia mosque in Kabul and Sunni mosque in Ghor province targeted in separate incidents, claiming more than 60 lives.
